_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The five warriors found in the world [an: The warrior who is killed and finished off by his foes
The warrior who is wounded and dies on the road before reaching his relatives
The warrior who is wounded, taken to his relatives, and dies of his injuries while in their care
The warrior who is wounded, taken to his relatives, recovers from his injuries while in their care
The warrior who wins victory in battle, establishing himself as foremost in battle
The five people similar to warriors foun: The person who is overcome with lust, has sex, and declares inability to continue training
The person who is overcome with lust, declares inability to continue training, and returns to a lesser life
The person who is overcome with lust, declares inability to continue training, but is advised and instructed by spiritual companions to continue training
The person who is overcome with lust, declares inability to continue training, but tries, struggles, and remains happy with the spiritual life
The person who achieves restraint over the sense faculties, enters and remains in the four absorptions, and attains liberation from defilements
